markdownRemark.html:
The focus of this site is to read and understand content. I started to think about what other sites and tools users interact with regularly.

Then it hit me.

I’d been reading loads of documentation from React, Gatsby, Mozilla docs, and learning for the past few months. Well, the goal for users that come to my site is to read and learn, so I’ve optimized this site for reading content.

I’ve made the typography straightforward with large headings in a Sans Serif, that I’ve paired with a nice serif font. It’s amazing what a little CSS can do to really make a site shine. Perfect Motherfucking Website

I chose a side navigation because I wanted users to be able to explore different projects quickly and easily, instead of painstakingly going back to the project page, and locate the next project.

I added a sidebar navigation, which you will commonly see in documentation sites. This is to allow users to move from project to project and have a clear sense of where they are located in the website at any given moment. It provides a clearer flow from page to page, instead of a fragmented experience while jumping back and forth between pages.
